climbs.name: Tacos Diablos
climbs.fa: FA: Tyler Phillips 2005  FFA: Brendan Nicholson 2007

content.description: Center line on the Tacos Diablo boulder.  Harder than it looks for the short length.
content.protection: 4 bolts.  Currently all but the first is fixed but the dog bones look to be a mix of old and new, might be worth replacing but you'll need a wrench for the quicklinks.

climbs.name: Pendejo
climbs.fa: Mike Perkins, Casey Hyer, Clay Watson. 2015

content.description: Rightmost route on the boulder.  Decent as a warmup for Tacos but not worth the trip for this alone.
content.protection: 4 bolts.  Finish on the Tacos anchor.

content.description: Need a better warm-up for the Taco? Scared of chossy aretes? Do you like link-ups? Do you struggle with the decision to pay the extra dollar for guac? Ok, that last one doesn't matter, but if you answered yes to any of the others, give this thing a try.
content.location: Starts on the left, sharing the same first bolt as Astroclay Verde. Clip a bolt out right and work your way up to the break, clipping another bolt before joining the top moves of Tacos Diablos (another bolt, then chains).

content.description: An EZ slab to keep the kids entertained while you get your butt handed to you while working Tacos Diablos.
content.location: Walk off or donate a biner to the 1 bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Astroclay Verde
climbs.fa: Casey Hyer, Clay Watson and Mike Perkins

content.description: Leftmost route on the boulder.  Funky climbing but worthy as a warmup.  Stay on the face and avoid the desire to pull onto the slab.
content.protection: 4 bolts.  Finish on the Tacos anchor.
